title: Incheon Airport to Open Duty-Free Shop in Arrivals
text:
Incheon International Airport will open the country's first duty-free shops in an arrivals section next year as part of a bid to support smaller companies as well as boost domestic spending.

The shops will not sell cigarettes, fruit or processed meat products, and each arrival will be allowed to buy only up to US$600 worth of products.

Finance Minister Kim Dong-yeon announced the plan on Thursday. It will require revising regulations by early 2019 and selecting operators, with the aim of opening the shops in late May or early June.
description: Incheon Airport to Open Duty-Free Shop in Arrivals
